A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: I'm really conflicted about this movie.  My 11 year old son loved it and thought it was fun\, but as an adult I gave a hard time calling this a good movie\, let alone a good Star Wars movie. I feel so let down by the \"tell don't show\" storytelling (for example\, Rose telling Finn \"you're the heroic Finn?\" or Poetry saying \"Look! X and X are facing off and going to fight\").  Don't just tell me someone's a hero or a legend!  Show me why!  I don't know what Rey learned in this movie.  Snoke was the least threatening mega villain ever. And there were so many long stretches where nothing of any consequence happened.  But there is fun spectacle and a few good jokes. But most of the jokes landed flat\, and the characterization was so secondary to plot. I want to love these characters and empathize with them\, but after this movie\, I honestly don't care how it all ends.
